element.name: Tymon Pact by moyle, Traditional Cache (1/1)
element.description: The cache is located close to the Pact Woodland project.
element.long-description:
The Pact Woodland project was initiated to commemorate 50 years of Pact's service. It's aim; to create a special commemorative area for all those who have been touched by adoption and unplanned pregnancy. The area is used by the local community and as a special place for meetings, reunions and reflection.
In 2004 Pact approached South Dublin County Council put forward the idea to "adopt" an existing beech woodland within East Tymon Park. A sculpture as a central feature
Three hands represent the three main areas of the agency's work and also symbolises the way in which an individual is held through the counselling process. The story of adopting a woodland
When a child is adopted, he or she gains two families: a birth family and an adoptive family. In a similar way the beech woodland within East Tymon Park now has two families; the local community are its original family and the Pact community it's adopted one
As part of the Pact woodland project, Pact decided to hold art workshops with each of these families. The Pact Adopted Persons Art Workshop
Children and adults who had been adopted through Pact were invited to fill a small canvas with some art on the theme "Nurture and Nature" and the returned art was framed together. The work is on display at the Pact office. The Pact Community Art Workshop
Children from the local community, in particular St. Judes' and Faughs' GAA clubs which border the park, were invited to participate in a series of workshops held in the woodland itself and later in Faugh's hall. They began by exploring the wood, making sketches and listening to stories about adoption. In later workshops they used their sketches to design and create clay tiles. The tiles were glazed in colour and then fired before being permanently displayed in the park between the lakes and pitches. The launch
The Pact Woodland was officially adopted on the 9th of September 2006 and the Pact Sculpture 'Cliabhán' unveiled by Cllr. Eamonn Maloney, Mayor of South Dublin County Council. Miriam O'Callaghan attended the launch and released approximately 1200 balloons, one for every child adopted through Pact since 1952.

ul.li:
2010-06-17T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by colmyster
Had trouble getting an accurate fix with this one so after about a half hour of rummaging in the bushes and with the light fading I let this one go...

2010-06-15T19:00:00Z : Write note by slands
Was in the adjoining playground with my daughter yesterday, and seeing the couple of DNFs, I decided to have a look. Sadly it was not where it was when I found this cache back in Feb, so it is either gone, or someone has replaced it somewhere different. [:(]
Stephen...

2010-06-13T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by Cibak
I'm very sorry, but there is nothing!!!!!! Cibak

2010-06-11T16:19:23Z : Didn't find it by iainrowe
Loads of Muggles around but what is supposed to be an easy find leads me to believe it has been removed

2010-05-21T19:00:00Z : Found it by Shorncliffe
My first geocache find. A bit concerned given the easy status but found ok.

2009-05-24T19:00:00Z : Found it by Kersti.com
Possibly the only glorious summers day of the year so naturally we were out on the bikes and off to do some caching. A really lovely little spot, hard to believe so much traffic is so close by. Cache easily found.

wpt.name: GC17Q4M
wpt.desc: Tymon Pact by moyle, Traditional Cache (1/1)
